title: Matías Osta-Vélez
text:
​I am a postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Philosophy, Heinrich-Heine University in Düsseldorf. I am also Lecturer at the Department of History and Philosophy of Science, University of the Republic, associated researcher (Lvl 1) at ANII, and external member of the Munich Center for Mathematical Philosophy
My work is focused on the foundations of cognitive science. In particular, I research about theories of reasoning and formal models of concepts. Other academic interests are philosophy of language (inferentialism), non-classical logic (relevant logics), social epistemology, and general philosophy of science (conceptual change and scientific rationality).
I studied philosophy, mathematical logic, and cognitive science at the University of the Republic, at the University of Paris 1 Panthéon-Sorbonne, and at the Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität. I did my PhD under the supervision of Stephan Hartmann and Max Kistler at the Munich Center for Mathematical Philosophy (LMU) and at the Institut d’Histoire et de Philosophie des Sciences et des Techniques(Paris 1/CNRS).


Education
Ludwig-Maximilians-Universitaet & Université Paris 1 Panthéon Sorbone | Munich/Paris  PhD in Philosophy of Science | 2017 - June 2020
Université Paris 1 Panthéon Sorbone | Paris  Master in Logic, Philosophy of Science and Epistemology | Sept 2007 - June 2011
Université Paris 1 Panthéon Sorbone | Paris  Master in Mathematical Logic | Sept 2007 - June 2011
Universidad de la República | Montevideo  BA in Philosophy | 2005-2010
